website_summaries.verdict: The ultimate curved screen monitor for multitasking, collaboration, and overall efficiency.
pros: The equivalent of two 24” monitors makes it a much better choice than a dual monitor setup
Includes an array of inputs, stereo speakers, highly flexible stand, an 1800R curve, eye saver mode, and other invaluable productivity perks
cons: All of that potential productivity comes at an expensive price

customer_reviews.title: Very happy, excellent monitor
customer_reviews.text: I was leery initially about purchasing a curved display, but I'm very happy with my 43" Samsung. It has a beautiful and sharp picture. Thank God glossy displays have fallen out of fashion! I considered the 49" version in this line, but decided the extra 6" was a bit too wide, but also that the 49" only has 1080 vertical resolution, whereas this 43" monitor has 1200. The only thing that might make this monitor "perfect" is if it had about 4" more height and 1600 vertical resolution, but I'm being greedy :) This is my 7th Samsung monitor ( I have a small business ) and all still operate even years after warranty. No dead pixels.
customer_reviews.author: B. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Awful backlight bleeding
customer_reviews.text: Sadly I will be returning as it had horrible backlight bleeding. See pics
customer_reviews.author: JonGP3

customer_reviews.title: Issues after only a couple months
customer_reviews.text: So, after a couple months of use. The right have if the month now has "snowlike" random pixels turning white then going back to normal. I've tried different computer, different cable, and even entirely different cable type. Unfortunately I'm out of the return window. I genuinely wanted to like this monitor. It was great when it either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor for Those Who Wear Progressive Glasses
customer_reviews.text: I used a 4K TV as a computer monitor to get more display space for multiple windows but with my progressive glasses I had to continually stretch my neck anytime I looked at a different are of the screen. With this monitor, I get the same viewing area because of the wide but shorter screen and the curvature of the screen, I don't have to contort my neck to keep everything in focus. The detail is just as good because the pixel size makes the pixels per inch very detailed. The color, when used with a 8K DSP cable is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Don D.

customer_reviews.title: KMD is hit or miss, as a simple monitor it's awesome
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make work easier while everything was shut down. The switch is really hit or miss, turn things on and off, plug in and out and I could get it working. Always took some fiddling with to get it operating how it should. Now that I'm back in the office I'm using this for gaming/every day PC use and it's awesome. I went from a 34" Ultra-wide to this and it was a nice upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Cook

customer_reviews.title: Awesome monitor.
customer_reviews.text: I love this monitor. I had dual monitors for years, this one is nicer, cleaner, looks great on the desk. I'm so happy with it. I can even work with 3 windows open effectively. I tried to use the USB C, but it didn't work with my laptop. So, I use an hdmi switch to go between two laptops. No big deal
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Assemble stand to monitor BEFORE removing
customer_reviews.text: First mon arrived damaged, with 2” vertical black bar on the left side, and white shadow in bottom center. Replacement mon is fine so far. It came inside an exterior carton, which may have reduced the chances for damage. When assembling, tear out a 6” circle of the white foam covering where the stand gets attached. USE STAND TO LIFT OUT THE MONITOR. Do not touch the monitor anywhere, until it and the stand are safely placed upon your desktop.
customer_reviews.author: trumpeter

customer_reviews.title: Not just for gaming
customer_reviews.text: I love this monitor because I can have my work laptop and personal computer hooked up to it and just switch back and forth with the touch of a button and use the same keyboard and mouse. It has been great since I have been working from home. I also like the picture in picture feature. You do have to make sure you have a compatible video card which I had to upgrade to but once I did that it worked great. Also, I had to contact Samsung customer service to help me figure out how to connect everything to get both my computers hooked up and they were wonderfully patient. I was very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: La Darden

customer_reviews.title: Great work monitor
customer_reviews.text: I use for business applications, so I can have multiple client's info on screen along with word and excel, small stock list or weather. Perfect for my work.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Excelent monitor, but has a very bad backlight bleed
customer_reviews.text: The resolution is superb, works very well with windows and macosx, with a long range of usb-c computers. The sound is very good considering the size of the speakers. The only compliant is the very notorious back-light bleeding in the lower center of the screen. Only for this the monitor is not really ready for the use in a corporate environment.
customer_reviews.author: radiazo

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy from OceanReefElectronics
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor but crap company I purchased it from, description says nothing about a defect on the lcd, went to return it they charged me a restocking fee for buyers remorse, will not buy from OceanReefElectronics stay away
customer_reviews.author: Auria

customer_reviews.title: great quality
customer_reviews.text: The Monitor has great quality and the picture looks sharp. Make sure you have a good graphics card. You'll be happy. I recommend this Samsung CJ89 43". It's good but not great for gaming. Again, gaming card a must. But for everyday computing, music, video editing you will be very happy. Also, consider that this is a 32-10 ratio. "10" makes it a little beefier. The 49'' ULTRA-WIDE are a bit slender (if you like that sort of thing) they are usually 32-9 ratio.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Mercado

customer_reviews.title: REVIEW MUNKIE. THE ONE REVIEW YOU NEED TO READ
customer_reviews.text: Widescreen 43 inch monitor. Pros. 43 inch and reasonable cost. Cons. Very deep. Confusing and counter intuitive menu controls. No dual hdmi. Cable management could have been better designed. Cable cover on back broke on second time it was removed. Recommended ? For the money - yes but only just. There are other options coming up with dell that will be better.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Great Gaming and Work Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor very happy with picture color and resolution. Wanted two monitors initially buy thought this the better choice. I can tab two browsers on opposite sides without bezel. Only negative is at times my MacBook Pro will not wake monitor for sleep. Purchased an Amazon refurbished and product came well packaged with all accessories.
customer_reviews.author: Darren808

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: The size is great. The picture is great. Some features need work. Like Eye Save Mode. It doesn't help me at all because Eye Save Mode won't let me turn down the brightness. An eye save app I bought on the Mac store works much better. Next, can't control the volume at all from a Mac. So, these monitor really should have came with a remote for volume control. I don't really like trying to hidden bottom bottom button to mute it. A remote would have helped tremendously .
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great for work
customer_reviews.text: Works great productivity wise. The button/menu interface is NOT user friendly though. If you are looking for some thing specifically for work or school, then this will fit your needs. The refresh rate is not great for gaming - I would pick something else if that’s your goal.
customer_reviews.author: Devin Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Once you've gone ultrawide you can't go back
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. The lack of pixels is actually great. The resolution is very comfortable for my workflow. Definitely needs a windowing snapping tool like Divvy from Mizage to place your work exactly where you like with a snap.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Make sure your computer is fairley new in order to handle the gpu draw
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I found was my computer was so outdated it expanded everything into very large bold pages. I could not get the monitor to shrink small enough to display correctly. My graphics card maxed out at 1920x1080. A new graphics card later fried my mother board. Now with a brand new updated gaming computer the 3840x1200 displays perfect. I have yet to fine tune the new pc to optimize the monitor. The only game I wanted to play on it was DCS and so far it does not display very well. I still have more research to do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice wide display!
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace 2-monitors at my work desk. This monitor has been great. It did show up with a few scratches on the backside, but not damage to the screen in anyway. Most of the time, when I work, I need to have several applications open or I need to see it wider to get a better view [like spreadsheets], and this monitor works great for all that. Color is great and I don't feel like I have to turn my head much at all. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: T. Mary Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Don’t delay, get it today.
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly the same as having two 24” 1920x1200 displays, but without the irritating plastic gap in the middle. I find it more useful because I can have a right, left, and center sections to the screen.
customer_reviews.author: Rhman15023

customer_reviews.title: Not great for work. Screen splitting is outdated.
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. This monitor is NOT compatible with Samsung’s easy box (screen splitting) software. Not great if you want the ability to snap a window to the center of the screen (to work on a document, etc.). Also, resolution is inferior to other wide screens. Returning mine today.
customer_reviews.author: Steve71

customer_reviews.title: Overall great monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Very good monitor. The only issue I have with it is sometimes when switching sources to another computer it doesn’t find it and it takes a while to make the switch. I wish there was any easier way to select the source vs it cycling through.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Excited, then disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to receive the monitor. Packaging appeared to be adequate and assembly was very easy. I connected it and turned it on, only to be greeted with a rather obvious black spot on the screen. Not sure if something happened during shipping, or it slipped past quality control. I spent about 30 minutes troubleshooting with Samsung, but it didn't go away, so back in the box and away it went. I'd like to buy it again, but Amazon is out of stock at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Nathalie R

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: The more I use it the more I love it. I can have both my Mac and PC viewed at the same time. Easy to switch between modes, too.
customer_reviews.author: H. M. Casey

customer_reviews.title: Good productivity monitor - very minor defect
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this monitor to have a larger workspace. The package arrived in good condition with only light damage from delivery. I used the VESA adapter and mounted it successfully. After a day of use, I notice some dead pixels in the top corner. Given the size of the monitor, this is minimal, though it is still a defect. After attempting to get a replacement, I've decided to live with this since it's small and far in a corner. If not for the defect, this would be 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Howard

customer_reviews.title: Very good for productivity.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for work, which consists of typing, coding, and video production. I like it a lot. My only complaint would be that my surface pro dock sometimes won't send to it without rebooting the surface. Might be the dock ...
customer_reviews.author: DVM

customer_reviews.title: this screen is amazing for editing
customer_reviews.text: I am not using this to watch films....I tried this out as a replacement to using two monitors to do editing on multiple word documents, spreadsheets, Project files, etc. The difference from dual monitors is just amazing. The screen has very useful eye-strain adjustments, the resolution is more than adequate for photoshop editing, and the lack of a gap between screens is a godsend. The curved screen is also much more of an improvement than one would have imagined. Everyone in my department is jealous of this purchase...and following suite!
customer_reviews.author: Markeaux

customer_reviews.title: Spots in the screen, on original and the replacement
customer_reviews.text: I am on my second screen (i have been using both for a total of about 2 weeks now) and both have had some kind of mark under the screen.
customer_reviews.author: Beerer

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor for the Money!
customer_reviews.text: I am enjoying this monitor, now that it is connected. Connecting was difficult, using different cables and many reboots. I would and have recommended this monitor to friends , with the caveat that there may be some trying times in connecting.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Buehler

customer_reviews.title: KVM feature needs work
customer_reviews.text: The KVM Feature works but is not easy to use. the Monitor does not allow you to move from source to source seamlessly. Otherwise great looking monitor for
customer_reviews.author: William J. Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Awesome monitor
customer_reviews.text: I got this for work... Best thing I've ever done for myself. I can have 5-6 windows open all at once. My productivity is so much better now.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade over a 34" ultrawide
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a Dell 34 inch ultrawide that I used for the past couple of years. The screen has about .25" less height, but has about 9-10 inches more horizontal space. Like the 120 hz refresh rate too.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Product Damaged
customer_reviews.text: Another review on here stated that there was a defect on the screen NOT due to Samsung but due to the shipping process. Likewise, when I received the monitor it had damage to the left bottom corner of the display. It wasn't significant but it was noticeable. I returned it and bought one at Micro Center instead. However, the monitor itself is good, especially the built-in audio.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Looks Great!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a Good Buy! Very happy No problems, Definitely would Recommend to a friend, Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: S C

customer_reviews.title: Love this Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Setup my MacBook as a my desktop with many goodies including this one. The picture is amazing
customer_reviews.author: Chromevrod

customer_reviews.title: Poor manufacturing quality control.
customer_reviews.text: Be careful of faulty manufacturing, first one ordered had a large screen bleed, replacement had major pixel flickering, second replacement was finally okay. Great screen when you’re able to get one that works.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny T

customer_reviews.title: KVM is not compatible with MAC
customer_reviews.text: After some troubles with UPS and amazon to obtain this product; I’m disappointed to find out that samsung does not cover Mac OS for the Easy setting box SW
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: Hooks right up - expansiveness of real estate is impressive.
customer_reviews.text: I use screen management tool to effectively have six "viewing zones" - Software "BetterSnapTool" - not a portable item.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo I. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong buying this
customer_reviews.text: IM still getting use the the screen size....It's like owning your own state...
customer_reviews.author: C L Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Very nice can open several screen at one time with excell and email and still see what is going on .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great color on a big space!
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality of this monitor is excellent. The colors are beautiful. The speakers are built into the monitor. They're not very good at bass, but one could hardly expect them to be for their size. The clarity is great and easy to read. I've never had a monitor this size. I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg Beary

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Loving it so far, I dont think I will ever go back to dual monitors
customer_reviews.author: rjl

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor poor hub
customer_reviews.text: Love the monitor but using it as a usb hub does not work very well, I can only get my external hard drive to work on one of the USB ports, and only one of the usb c ports doesn’t seem to work
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: must buy
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product. It makes my day so much productive and I enjoy working on it, even its for schooling, work, or trading stocks . You can use WinDock software to divide your screen into multiple screens so you can multitask. I would recommend it to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Jervie Duhaylungsod

customer_reviews.title: Good size, but poor picture quality
customer_reviews.text: The monitor is very big. Bigger than I expected. It has a very comprehensive ports set. However, the picture quality is bad. (Note: I am from an 200+ PPI monitor).
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Great picture, huge and heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor, huge. Running 3 apps at a time with plenty of screen. Monitor is heavy and getting to the ports is a bit of a challenge if you can’t get behind it.
customer_reviews.author: G M P

customer_reviews.title: Immersive with great picture quality
customer_reviews.text: Awesome monitor for an immersive experience. Easy to setup, easy to connect and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Medhi

customer_reviews.title: Redd
customer_reviews.text: Don't use it for games. it is perfect for work at home.
customer_reviews.author: Redd

customer_reviews.title: Photo editing/Gaming are great
customer_reviews.text: I'm a heavy photo editor and occasional PC gamer. Color accuracy is great, editing photos and color correcting is a beautiful process. Games look better than ever, and playing fullscreen adds even more immersion. Although not all games support the aspect ratio. Switching to ultrawide from a dual monitor setup was made simple with this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous.
customer_reviews.text: Surpasses dual monitors and has great picture quality with a so-so video card.
customer_reviews.author: J Melson

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I ordered and arrived on time on some resolutions normal computer screen viewing like a Word document will have some color discrepancies.
customer_reviews.author: pdavis830

customer_reviews.title: Impressive Widescreen monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and impressive monitor. My clients are wowed they have never seen such a monitor. Everyone thst has seen it loves it and are jelous in a good way. Very useful with multiple windows. My neck hurts from turning from one end to the other....kinda hard to see when full screen view is active.
customer_reviews.author: jose rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Finally pulled the trigger!
customer_reviews.text: After years of following and waiting to purchase a curved Monitor for gaming, finally made the purchase. My Samsung C43J89 CJ89 Series 43-inch Ultrawide Curved Monitor was shipped to Miami, then to the country I currently reside in. For the past 2 weeks the monitor has been perfect, great product and GJ Samsung/Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: RKL

customer_reviews.title: Use this monitor everyday for work.
customer_reviews.text: It is essential for number crunchers like me, whom need to see the entire spreadsheet.
customer_reviews.author: Mehran

customer_reviews.title: Terrible monitor for Mac. Takes forever to wake up from sleep.
customer_reviews.text: Takes forever to wake up from sleep. Samsung help is absolutely terrible. The worst of any tech company that I have ever dealt with. Sent it back. Bought an LG 38 and I like it a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Len Laviolette

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic monitor. Went from two 27's to the CJ89 and got back a little desk space. Zero dead pixels, fantastic image quality!
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: So much screen
customer_reviews.text: I had a 35 inch curved monitor. I upgraded to this one and I'm not disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Lamone

customer_reviews.title: Cou;d be the best monitor ever - other than the Mac.
customer_reviews.text: It's like having 3.5 screens in one. Perrect for someone with ADD, and likes to work on several windows at once. The curve makes it very easy on the eyes.
customer_reviews.author: M. Taunton-Elsey

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality screen with deep contrast and good colors. For anyone thinking about a 49 vs 43 inch ultrawide, 43 is where its at. Not too long and covers wide area.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Meets expectation
customer_reviews.text: Good for our office, but you will need a large desk. Resolution for this size isn’t as high as some of the slightly smaller Samsung screens.
customer_reviews.author: Diamond Thomas

customer_reviews.title: not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Connections are all bad it is only working with one connection. all wires are in hard to reach place. not support from amazon when i request for manual.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Extremely satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is exactly what the doctor ordered. I use it for work as an IT Professional. I can have multiple pages open.
customer_reviews.author: Rex Terrance Edrington

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality is supurb! So far I have enjoyed using it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Layne

customer_reviews.title: Useful product for front desk of large organization.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Needed for our front desk administrator to be able to operate phone system and other systems simultaneously. Works great! She is the envy of our office.
customer_reviews.author: Marla Wood

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor, great picture quality. It is missing a remote control.
customer_reviews.author: P Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Awesome monitor
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome monitor it blew away all of my expectations
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: High quality screen
customer_reviews.text: I play Fifa and I can see the whole field! Also great for work having 2-3 windows open
customer_reviews.author: tung lee

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitior
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my home office. Love the unobstructed view and the price is great!
customer_reviews.author: David F Borbas

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Monitor!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the quality of the monitor, speakers and features of KvM
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Excellent resolution
customer_reviews.text: Easy to your eyes. Excellent resolution. looks good. easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Pablo Benavides

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Only problem is no keyboard shortcut key for switching between computers.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Bailey

product_meta.title: Samsung CJ89 43" Curved UltraWide 3840 X 1200 Resolution 120Hz Monitor (LC43J890DKNXZA), Black
product_meta.description:
Immersive multitasking by Super Ultra-Wide Curved
•Real dual-monitor experience in one screen
→2 sets of 24”(16:10) = 1 set of 43” (32:10)
•Easy-to-use built-in KVM switch with hot key
•2 ports of USB Type-C. Power Consumption (Max) - 220W. The brightness is 300cd/m2
feature_bullets: At 43" diagonal screen size and 32:10 aspect ratio, the CJ89 is equvilent to 24" monitors put together, making it a smart alternative to dual monitor setups with no bezel blind spots, perfectly matched image quality, and fewer cables

Picture-by-Picture lets you display input from two PCs simultaneously for effortless collaboration with colleagues or clients. Simply connect a second device such as a laptop to instantly view its display side by side with your primary PC’s display

The rapid 120 Hz screen refresh rate provides flawlessly smooth scenes and can be adjustable to 60 Hz for optimized monitor performance. Dimensions (W x H x D) Product Dimensions With Stand 41.84 x 20.65 x 12.38 Inches. Product Dimensions Without Stand- 41.84 x 14.14 x 6.87 Inches

: When two devices are connected to the CJ89, its built-in KVM switch lets you control them both using just one keyboard and mouse. Multitask efficiently and save desk space; Power Consumption (Stand-by): Less than 0.3 W

USB Type-C transmits data, video and audio, and power all over a single cable. Connect a smartphone, tablet, or laptop to one of the monitor's two USB Type-C ports to display content onscreen and charge the device at the same time

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars238 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
